title: Gir Forest National Park
short_description: The last abode of the Asiatic Lion, a dry deciduous forest teeming with leopards and deer.
long_description: Gir National Park and Wildlife Sanctuary, also known as Sasan Gir, is a forest and wildlife sanctuary near Talala Gir in Gujarat, India. It is the only place in the world outside Africa where a lion can be seen in its natural habitat. Established in 1965, the total area of the sanctuary is 1,412 kmÂ². The park is a mix of scattered scrub and open deciduous forest, providing an ideal terrain for the Asiatic Lion. The lions of Gir are a majestic sight, and thanks to dedicated conservation efforts, their population has seen a steady increase. Apart from lions, Gir is home to a significant population of leopards, sambar deer, chital, and over 300 species of birds.
wildlife_significance: The sole home of the pure Asiatic Lions (Panthera leo persica) and a critical site for their conservation.
guides_and_tips: Permits are strictly online. The Devalia Interpretation Zone offers guaranteed sightings if you miss them in the main park.
how_to_reach: By Air: Diu Airport (80 km) or Rajkot Airport (160 km). By Rail: Junagadh (60 km) and Veraval (45 km) are major stations.
permits_and_fees: Permits must be booked 3 months in advance on the girlion.gujarat.gov.in website.
conservation_notes: The park is a success story of lion conservation, bouncing back from near extinction. Human-wildlife conflict management is a key focus.
sample_itinerary: Day 1: Arrive Sasan Gir. Visit Devalia Safari Park in the evening. Day 2: Early morning Jeep Safari in the main sanctuary. Visit Kamleshwar Dam. Afternoon leisure/Tribal village walk. Day 3: Departure.
safety_tips: Do not tease the animals. Flash photography is prohibited. Stay within the vehicle at all times.

entry_fees.notes: Includes permit and guide fee roughly for a group of 6. Varies by weekday/weekend.

operating_season.season_notes: Devalia Safari Park stays open on Wednesdays throughout the year (except during heavy rain).

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Weekend and festival rates are higher.
